snippet: Kurdish pesh merga fighters and Iraqi security forces began efforts to drive out the Islamic State from several parts of northern Iraq, including near the Syria border.
abstract: Kurdish fighters open successful offensives against Islamic State militants in northern Iraq; seize control of border crossing with Syria that has been a major conduit for the insurgents.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Omar al-Jawoshy, Sarmad Chalabi and Ali Hamza from Baghdad, and employees of The New York Times from Kirkuk, Mosul and Sulaimaniya, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: Kurdish pesh merga fighters and Iraqi security forces began efforts to drive out the Islamic State from several parts of northern Iraq, including near the Syria border.

headline.main: Kurds in Iraq’s North Make Gains Against Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Kurds in Iraq’s North Make Gains Against Islamic State

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
